title: Large-Scale Web-Based HTML Coding Learning Course Using Visual Models: Digital Literacy Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and internet usage experience, with basic comprehension of digital society
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, this course focuses on understanding HTML structures and developing debugging skills through visual models. Aims to enhance information accessibility in digital society and bridge the technology gap.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the connection between HTML tags and web page output results with 80% accuracy using visual models (diagrams/arrows) and understand information representation structures in digital society.

Learners can complete a provided HTML task (e.g., basic page structure) in ≤3 attempts in a simulation environment and achieve ≥70% accuracy in error correction, thereby developing digital problem-solving skills.

Learners can independently create a two-page static web page (including header, body, ≥3 images) using HTML/CSS within three weeks and achieve ≥70 points on an internal corporate evaluation rubric (design 20%, functionality 30%, content suitability 50%), thereby demonstrating digital citizenship competencies.

resources: HTML debugging practice sample code set
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
